root_title: Historical Evolution of Human Rights / Evolucion Historica de Los DerechosHumanos
body:
***English Version***

##### **Historical Evolution of Human Rights**

![law-g187332c08_1920.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/iscrak/23w38YZ4e41FqayhMqG19xmQE23Tbk6DFRdt9vr24hSUMwMVi7GkEdiPPsWzdKuf9bS2R.jpg)
[Image extracted from Pixabay](https://pixabay.com/es/illustrations/ley-derecho-humano-humano-las-manos-597133/)

**<center>Introduction</center>**

>Currently Human Rights constitute the fundamental pillar of life in society and must be respected without any objection, which is why their study and analysis is of great importance, below is a chronological description of how these rights evolved from its rudimentary character to the level of scope and technification that they have today.

>It is also explained how both religion, culture and politics go hand in hand in the construction of laws and systems of social order that seek to maintain order, but always seek to protect the interests of certain sectors over others, it is also interesting to appreciate as despite the differences between each human civilization there is a common point, which allows individual rights to evolve in a similar way in different latitudes.

>With the arrival of the French Revolution as the first breaking point, it can be seen that the refoundation of the modern State comes loaded with new ideas that seek to change the known world in its entirety, since feudalism and monarchical absolutism would come to an end and it would be the popular masses that are the majority that will decide its future.

>Lastly, the Second World War would be the historical event that would finish demolishing the old international structures and give way to the new world order, with the creation of the United Nations Organization and the consolidation of a world legal system that would allow them to become universal and the inviolability of human rights.

**<center>Historical, philosophical and social political evolution for the current configuration of civil and political rights</center>**

>Since the beginning of civilization, it can be observed how, with the passage of time, human beings evolve in their way of relating to their environment, in most cases they seek a way of living together harmoniously and with rules that allow life in community, a sample of this situation can be observed in all religions and cultures, in the first millennium BC The Hindu epic-mythological text called Mahabharata expresses the following: "Whatever a person does not want done to him, he must refrain from doing it to others."

>The great ancient civilizations such as Mesopotamia, Rome, Greece and Egypt achieved great social advances that allowed the establishment of legal norms that were intended to gradually regulate the behavior of their citizens, an example of this is the Urukagina Code, the Code of Ur-Nammu, the Code of Hammurabi, Roman Law, among others, when the characteristics of each of them are thoroughly realized, it is evident that their application seeks to punish various crimes that are not tolerated within life in society, normally by means of a punishment proportional to the crime committed, however, this does not represent a protection or an establishment of individual rights as we know it today, but without a doubt they mark the beginning of the modern legal system.
  
>In ancient times culture and religion were closely linked and in most cases political and social decisions had very important theological and philosophical burdens, both Buddhism, Christianity, Judaism and Islam prevailed in their respective societies thus building a strict legal, religious and social framework, which sought to preserve the established order but at the same time allowed it to expand its influence throughout the world. Without a doubt, due to their great doctrinal differences, each religion struggled to prevail over the other, but deep down there is a meeting point between them since they coincide in a doctrine that prioritizes justice, solidarity and respect to achieve a life harmonious in community, this is the factor that drives law on a path of clear historical evolution and that seeks to cover more and more space, covering the great existing legal gaps.

>From 1492 with the discovery of America by the Spaniards and European feudalism in its heyday, human relations began to change dramatically, while peninsulars and whites enjoyed great privileges and rights, slaves, blacks and mestizos were not part of society, on the other hand the indigenous, although they were protected by various papal bulls, continued to be victims of massacres and extermination by the colonizers. In this situation, it can be seen how the society of that time was segregated by categories, which constitutes a serious distortion that would put social relations at risk. Until this point in history, the relationship between religion and politics is still formally maintained. It is important to remember that the Spanish kings were characterized by being Catholic and under the influence of the Vatican, while the English kept the crown and the crown under the same individual. Anglican religion, but this union between both factors (religion and politics) would begin to fracture since on many occasions religious interests began to disagree with the personal interests of the rulers of the day, and at the same time social pressure increased which turned this situation into a ticking time bomb.

>Between 1775 and 1783, with the war of independence of the United States, the prevailing status quo would begin to change until then, a situation that would reach its highest point in 1789 when French absolutism was overthrown and the revolution was proclaimed. whose first action was to approve the Declaration of the Rights of Man and of the Citizen, a document that established for the first time in history a series of rights inherent to the human condition, which could not be transgressed and at the same time the new and nascent State had to protect them, it can be determined that this declaration and the events that occurred in France during the revolution were the profound forces that drove the American colonies in their process of emancipation and subsequent independence.

>The French Revolution brought with it a series of novel ideas that would completely transform the world and would have repercussions to this day. First of all, when looking at the Declaration of the Rights of Man and of the Citizen, it can be seen how it speaks directly of the right to the freedom of every individual by birth, the protection of the natural rights of man, the participation of citizens in the political life of the state, the limitations of the government regarding the use of force and the establishment of sovereignty in the nation and not about a particular individual, among others.

>In addition to this, a series of actions also arose that allowed the ideas of the declaration to be applied within the new State, hence the well-known term of Jacques Rousseau called: "The Social Contract", which is a work of the type philosophical and political that deals mainly with the freedom and equality of men under the tutelage of a State constituted by means of a social pact, which through a session of rights and freedoms voluntarily and individually constitutes a government that sets the barriers of social behavior, thus allowing a harmonious coexistence of all the members that make up this community, from this point the construction of modern constitutions would begin, which will be the fundamental laws of each State.

>Moving forward in time, another important point in modern history can be reached and one that will be defining in order to understand the constitution of today's international society. This milestone is the Second World War, which was a global war that forced to make a 360 degree turn and refound the entire structure of human coexistence, once the Japanese surrender was signed on September 2, 1945, which ended the conflict, it was extremely necessary to configure a new world order that would ensure the non- repetition of the atrocities committed by Nazi Germany and its allies against social groups and entire nations, which is why on October 24, 1945, they decided to create the United Nations Organization and on December 10, 1948, the Universal Declaration would be approved. of Human Rights, which is the legal instrument with the greatest scope in terms of the protection of individual rights, which from this mo They have a universal character, they are also inherent to the human condition and cannot be transgressed by any actor in society, in addition, with the passage of time, specialized international courts and entities were created that are in charge of monitoring, overseeing, promoting and protecting these rights globally.

>Despite the fact that this declaration contained a large number of rights, over time it was possible to determine that important legal gaps remained and that rights such as universal suffrage were not being considered by many States and it was increasingly important to make them visible, which is why that on March 23, 1976, the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights entered into force, which seeks to protect freedom in all its dimensions: legal, legal, individual, thought, social, cultural and economic.

**<center>Conclusions</center>**

>Undoubtedly, Human Rights have their roots in ancient civilizations and it is thanks to these influences that they can be constituted today, over the years humanity has learned from many of its own mistakes, there are setbacks and advances but without a doubt, the distance traveled is quite long and the improvement of the systems for the protection of individual rights is more than evident.

>The evolution of society goes hand in hand with the strengthening and growth of individual protection systems since the essential characteristic of human communities is constant change and that is why laws and rights must be reviewed and updated periodically, in order to avoid situations that in other times were very unfortunate. There are still challenges to overcome, but the international system has robust institutions that allow real-time monitoring of the current situation in each State of the world, with a few exceptions.

>The protection and dissemination of Human Rights is everyone's task, which means that both citizens, governments and international organizations have shared responsibilities in this matter. Nowadays, with a globalized world, it is much easier to have access to information and this is an advantage when developing policies that allow the daily improvement of Human Rights.

***Version en Español***

##### **Evolucion Historica de Los DerechosHumanos** 

![law-g187332c08_1920.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/iscrak/23w38YZ4e41FqayhMqG19xmQE23Tbk6DFRdt9vr24hSUMwMVi7GkEdiPPsWzdKuf9bS2R.jpg)
[Imagen extraída de Pixabay](https://pixabay.com/es/illustrations/ley-derecho-humano-humano-las-manos-597133/)

**<center>Introducción</center>**

>En la actualidad los Derechos Humanos constituyen el pilar fundamental de la vida en sociedad y deben ser respetados sin objeción alguna, es por ello que su estudio y análisis es de gran importancia, a continuación se presenta una descripción cronológica de cómo estos derechos fueron evolucionando desde su carácter rudimentario hasta el nivel de alcance y tecnificación que tienen hoy en día. 

>Además se explica cómo tanto la religión, la cultura y la política van de la mano en la construcción de leyes y sistemas de orden social que buscan mantener el orden, pero siempre procuran proteger los intereses de ciertos sectores sobre otros, también  es interesante apreciar como a pesar de las diferencias existentes entre cada civilización humana existes un punto en común, lo cual permite que los derechos individuales vallan evolucionando de forma similar en diversas latitudes. 

>Con  la llegada de la revolución francesa como primer punto de quiebre se puede ver que la refundación del Estado moderno viene cargado de nuevas ideas que buscan cambiar al mundo conocido en su totalidad, ya que el feudalismo, y el absolutismo monárquico llegaría a su fin y serían las masas populares que son la mayoría las que decidirán su futuro. 

>Por último la segunda guerra mundial seria el acontecimiento histórico que terminaría de demoler las viejas estructuras internacionales y daría paso al nuevo orden mundial, con la creación de la Organización de la Naciones Unidas y la consolidación de un sistema jurídico mundial que permitiría darles el carácter  universal y la inviolabilidad  a los Derechos Humanos.
 

**<center>Evolución histórica, filosófica y político social para la configuración actual de los derechos civiles y políticos</center>**

>Desde el inicio de la civilización se puede observar como con el pasar del tiempo el ser humano va evolucionando en su forma de relacionarse con su entorno, en la mayoría de los casos busca una forma de convivir de manera armoniosa y con reglas que permitan la vida en comunidad, una muestra de esta situación la podemos observar en todas las religiones y culturas, en el primer milenio A.C.  El  texto épico-mitológico  Hindú denominado  Mahabharata expresa lo siguiente: "Todo lo que una persona no desea que le hagan, debe abstenerse de hacerlo a los demás."

>Las grandes civilizaciones antiguas como Mesopotamia, Roma, Grecia y Egipto lograron grandes avances sociales que permitieron el establecimiento de normas legales que tenían como objeto  regular poco a poco el comportamiento de sus ciudadanos, una muestra de ello es el Código de Urukagina, el Código de Ur-Nammu, el Código de Hammurabi, el Derecho Romano, entre otros, cuando se realiza a fondo las características propias de cada uno de ello es evidente que su aplicación busca castigar diversos delitos que no son tolerados dentro de la vida en sociedad, normalmente mediante un castigo proporcional al crimen cometido, ahora bien esto no representa una protección o un establecimiento de derechos individuales como lo conocemos hoy pero sin duda alguna marcan el inicio del sistema legal moderno.
  
>En la antigüedad la cultura y la religión estaban estrechamente ligadas y en la mayoría de los casos las decisiones políticas y sociales tenían cargas teológicas y filosóficas  muy importantes,  tanto el budismo, el cristianismo,  el judaísmo y el islam se impusieron en sus respectivas sociedades construyendo así un entramado jurídico, religiosos y social estricto, que buscaba preservar el orden establecido pero al mismo tiempo permitía expandir su influencia a lo largo del mundo.  Sin duda alguna que debido a sus grandes diferencias doctrinarias cada religión luchaba por imponerse sobre la otra, pero el en fondo existe entre ellas un punto de encuentro ya que coinciden en una doctrina que prioriza la justicia, la solidaridad y el respeto para lograr una vida armoniosa en comunidad, este es el factor que impulsa al derecho en una senda de clara evolución histórica y que busca abarcar cada vez más espacio tapando los grandes vacíos legales existentes. 

>A partir de 1492 con el descubrimiento de América por parte de los españoles y el feudalismo europeo en su pleno apogeo las relaciones humanas comenzaron a cambiar de forma vertiginosa, mientras los peninsulares y blancos gozaban de grandes privilegios y derechos, los  esclavos, negros  y mestizos no formaban parte de la sociedad, por otro lado los indígenas si bien se encontraban protegidos por diversas bulas papales seguían siendo víctima de masacres y exterminio por parte de los colonizadores. En esta situación se puede observar como la sociedad de ese entonces se encontraba segregada por categorías, lo cual constituye una distorsión grave que pondría en riesgo las relaciones sociales. Hasta este punto de la historia aún se mantiene formalmente  la relación entre religión y política, es importante recordar que los reyes españoles se caracterizaban por ser católicos y estar bajo la influencia del Vaticano,  mientras que los ingleses mantenían bajo un mismo individuo la corona y la religión anglicana, pero ya esta unión entre ambos factores (religión y política) comenzaría a fracturarse ya que en muchas ocasiones los intereses religiosos comenzaban a discrepar con los intereses personales de los gobernantes de turno, y al mismo tiempo la presión social aumentaba lo cual convertía esta situación en una bomba de tiempo. 

>Entre los años 1775 y 1783 con la guerra de independencia de los Estados Unidos comenzaría a cambiar el status quo imperante hasta entonces, situación que llegaría a su punto de mayor nivel en el año 1789 cuando derrocan al absolutismo francés y se proclama la revolución, cuya primera acción fue aprobar la Declaración de los Derechos del Hombre y del Ciudadano, documento que fijo por primera vez en la historia una serie de derechos inherentes a la condición humana, que no podían ser trasgredidos y al mismo tiempo el nuevo y naciente Estado debía protegerlos, se puede determinar que esta declaración y los hechos acontecidos en Francia durante la revolución fueron las fuerzas profundas que impulsaron a las colonias Americanas en su proceso de emancipación y posterior independencia. 

>La Revolución Francesa trajo consigo una serie de ideas novedosas que transformarían por completo al mundo y tendrían repercusiones hasta nuestros días, en primer lugar al mirar la Declaración de los Derechos del Hombre y del Ciudadano se puede observar cómo se habla directamente del derecho a la la libertad de todo individuo por nacimiento, de la protección de los derechos naturales del hombre, la participación de los ciudadanos en la vida política del estado, las limitaciones del gobierno  en cuanto al uso de la fuerza y el establecimiento de la soberanía en la nación y no sobre un individuo en particular, entre otros. 

>Aunado a esto también surgieron una serie de acciones que permitieron llevar las ideas de la declaración a su aplicabilidad dentro del nuevo Estado, de allí el tan conocido termino de Jacques Rousseau denominado: “El Contrato Social”, el cual es una obra del tipo filosófica y política que trata principalmente sobre la libertad y la igualdad de los hombres bajo la tutela se un Estado constituido por medio de un pacto social, el cual mediante una sesión de derechos y libertades de forma voluntaria e individual se constituye un gobierno que fija las barreras del comportamiento social, permitiendo así una convivencia armoniosa de todos los integrantes que conforman esta comunidad, desde este punto iniciaría la construcción de las constituciones modernas las cuáles serán las leyes fundamentales de cada Estado. 

>Avanzando en el tiempo se puede llegar a otro punto importante en la historia moderna y que será definitorio para entender la constitución de la sociedad internacional de nuestros días, este hito es la Segunda Guerra Mundial, el cual fue un conflicto bélico a escala global que obligo a dar un giro de 360grados  y refundar toda la estructura de la convivencia humana, una vez firmada la rendición japonesa el 2 de septiembre de 1945 lo cual daba por terminado el conflicto, era de extrema necesidad configurar un nuevo orden mundial que asegurara la no repetición de las atrocidades cometidas por la Alemania nazi y sus aliados contra grupos sociales  y naciones  completas, es por ello que el 24 de octubre de 1945 de decide crear La Organización de las Naciones Unidas y el 10 de diciembre de 1948 se aprobaría  La Declaración Universal de los Derechos Humanos, la cual es el instrumento jurídico de mayor alcance en cuanto a la protección de derechos individuales, los cuales a partir de este momento cuentan con carácter universal, además son inherentes a la condición humana y no pueden ser trasgredidos por ningún actor de la sociedad, además con el pasar del tiempo se fueron creando cortes y entes internacionales especializados que se encargan de monitorear, vigilar, fomentar y proteger estos derechos a nivel global. 

>A pesar de que esta declaración una gran cantidad de derechos, con el tiempo se pudo determinar que quedaban vacíos legales importantes y que  derechos como el voto universal no estaban siendo contemplados por muchos Estados y cada vez era más importante hacerlo visible, es por ello que en el 23 de marzo de 1976 entra en vigor  El Pacto internacional de Derechos Civiles y Políticos, el cual busca proteger la libertad en todas sus dimensiones: legal, jurídica, individual, de pensamiento, social, cultural y económica.
 
 
**<center>Conclusiones</center>**

>Sin duda alguna que los Derechos Humanos tienen sus raíces en las civilizaciones antiguas y gracias a estas influencias es que se pueden constituir hoy en día, a lo largo de los años la humanidad ha aprendido de muchos de sus propios errores, existen retrocesos y avances pero sin duda que el trecho recorrido es bastante largo y el perfeccionamiento de los sistemas de protección de los derechos individuales es más que evidente. 

>La evolución de la sociedad va de la mano con el fortalecimiento y el crecimiento de los sistemas de protección individual ya que la característica esencial de las comunidades humanas es el cambio constante y es por ello que las leyes y los derechos deben ser revisados y actualizados de forma periódica, para de este modo evitar situaciones que en otras épocas fueron muy lamentables. Aún existen retos por superar pero el sistema internacional cuenta con instituciones robustas que permiten monitorear en tiempo real la situación actual en cada Estado del mundo, salvo algunas contadas excepciones. 

>La protección y difusión de los Derechos Humanos es tarea de todos, lo cual significa que tanto los ciudadanos, como los gobiernos y las organizaciones internacionales cuentan con responsabilidades compartidas en esta materia. En la actualidad con un mundo globalizado es mucho más fácil tener acceso a la información y esto es una ventaja al momento de desarrollar políticas que permitan el perfeccionamiento cotidiano de los Derechos Humanos.

body:
>"...you've been born into a world, a society in which all the rules are already set in stone."

Ah, if only that were so, everthing would be so much simpler!  But, as you surely know, it is not so.  The physical laws of the universe may be unchanging (but not according to many cosmologists who propound a period of inflation in the very early universe), and Jack London's law of tooth and claw, of nature in which predators forever will hunt their prey (although it has been said that the lion will lay down with the lamb one day), but I doubt any would agree that human society has rules cast in stone (at least that are today in effect, despite the Code of Hammurabi, and the more recent Georgia Guidestones).

The only thing we can count on ever being the same always is change.  In 2011 the left was a force obdurately opposed to the banksters, and Occupy Wall Street, outraged at the duplicity and fraud of thieves who were too big to fail receiving $100's of billions, while homeowners were stripped of their homes and considered of no consquence, protested and marched for justice.

Then they were infiltrated by spooks, their outrage redirected at identity politics, and the fat, fraudulent banksters began bankrolling them.

![ows.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/valued-customer/241FFbNnYBEN2PR2eR6EFXh2SaS2CcpMeUXtoooPWr7nggxYMkt9NmnXm1GJacyZwnP6G.jpg)

Boy, oh boy, did things change!  Now the left finds pallets of bricks left for their protests by friendly police, is completely the equivalent of RWDS's for their corporate masters, and demands censorship silence anyone that dares to disobey their edicts.  In only ten years the rules of leftists became completely the opposite of what they once were.

So, no, the rules aren't cast in stone.

We make them as we go.

Thanks!

root_title: Pifiar el Boticario (Relato) /ESP-ENG/ Pifiar The Apothecary (Story)
body: Pifiar hijo de Potifera y hermano de Asenat, por lo tanto cuñado de José al que llamaban Zafenat Panéa desde que alcanzara la gracia de Faraón, fue un destacado inversionista de su tiempo de cuyas hazañas logramos saber gracias al reciente descubrimiento de una estela de jeroglíficos traducidos con brillantez por el sabio de origen levantino Cide Hamete Benengeli que nos relata lo siguiente: Pifiar amaba el dinero y siendo algo cobarde no quiso seguir la carrera militar como su padre, tampoco alcanzó brillantez en las escuelas de misterios para aspirar al puesto de sacerdote, pero astuto hizo carrera en el comercio y gracias a los contactos familiares logró en poco tiempo crear una red de boticas en Egipto y regiones vecinas. En todas la importantes ciudades estaba presente desde Tebas y con ayuda de una red de caravanas surtía su negocio con pócimas, ungüentos y sellos que la farmacopea y otras ciencias curaban multitud de enfermedades que según las estaciones atacaban a ricos y pobres. El negocio prosperó por décadas y Pifiar disfrutaba de lujos y placeres como ninguno, hasta que un buen día se enamoró de la más hermosa hija de Babilonia. Modená o Monsana se llamaba la prodigiosa doncella que deslumbraba con belleza y sabiduría, discípula los magos de oriente conocedora las ciencias y algunas artes ocultas. Modená convino en casarse con Pifiar a condición de que la hiciera socia de la lucrativa red de Boticas y le permitiera incorporar a la oferta elixires de su total invención, pero que nunca revelaría sus fórmulas secretas y si en siete años no lograba duplicar el capital se convertiría en su esclava y le cedería las tierras y posesiones de su familia en medio del Eufrates y el Tigris. Pifiar acepto y ante el escriba firmó contrato y poder a Modená que desde aquel día manejó el negocio, sucediendo que de tal manera mejoraron las cosas, Pifiar se aficionó a contar monedas de oro y comprar perlas y piedras preciosas procedentes de los cuatro confines de la tierra. ![image.png](https://images.ecency.com/DQmRbZmrWSSePfU1xkm5hgwqPxcHtX493zoStWWn3LKdTzS/image.png) [Fuente](https://pixabay.com/es/photos/egipto-templo-jerogl%C3%ADficos-fara%C3%B3n-1197827/) //////////////////////////////////////////////// -O- //////////////////////////////////////////// Fracturada la estela en este punto desconocemos los detalles de los años más prósperos de Pifiar y Modená, pero en la base se encuentra un inesperado y revelador final. /////////////////////////////////////////////// -O- //////////////////////////////////////////// ![image.png](https://images.ecency.com/DQmQ9hJv6enP8bvqtYtJdz2mheWk5gHToR26QoN9U4BDk88/image.png) [Fuente](https://www.flickr.com/photos/viviendoenlaerapop/6669326339)estela de diorita de Hammurabi, fragmento. Corrían los tranquilos días primavera, luego de superar la mortal peste que asoló todos los reinos conocidos, cuando sorpresivamente Pifiar y Modená recibieron convocatoria de presentarse al término de la distancia frente a Faraón. Reunidos los cortesanos, sabios y sacerdote a izquierda y derecha, en el centro permanecían erguidos y desafiante los que parecían derviches del desierto o la lejana India que ante toda la corte, al presentarse Pifiar y Modená repitieron la acusación que conocían los presentes: Los acaudalados boticarios grandemente enriquecidos con sus elixires habían esparcido la peste mediante sus preparados y algunos se curaban y otros no, misterio de la naturaleza. Como su más fuerte argumento presentaban los conocidos frascos de la botica y retaban a los dueños a ingerirlo de inmediato en presencia de Faraón y la corte. Pifiar bebió y Modená con insolencia bebió y se bañó con el contenido de los restantes frascos abalanzándose contra Faraón, que protegido por sus guardias presenció con ojos atónitos la muerte de ambos y algunos de los guardias. Algunos historiadores creen que esta fue la causa de la desaparición de las boticas en tiempos antiguos, no apareciendo hasta 1221 en Florencia. # And in English Pifiar son of Potifera and brother of Asenath, therefore Joseph's brother-in-law who was called Zafenat Panéa since he reached the favor of Pharaoh, was an outstanding investor of his time whose exploits we learn thanks to the recent discovery of a stele of translated hieroglyphs brilliantly by the sage of Levantine origin Cide Hamete Benengeli who tells us the following: Pifiar loved money and being a bit of a coward, he did not want to follow a military career like his father, nor did he achieve brilliance in the mystery schools to aspire to the position of priest, but cunningly he made a career in commerce and thanks to family contacts he managed in a short time create a network of drugstores in Egypt and neighboring regions. In all the important cities he was present from Thebes and with the help of a network of caravans he supplied his business with potions, ointments and seals that the pharmacopoeia and other sciences cured a multitude of diseases that according to the seasons attacked rich and poor. The business prospered for decades and Pifiar enjoyed luxuries and pleasures like no other, until one fine day he fell in love with the most beautiful daughter of Babylon. Modená or Monsana was the name of the prodigious maiden who dazzled with beauty and wisdom, she was a disciple of the wise men from the East, knowing the sciences and some occult arts. Modená agreed to marry Pifiar on the condition that she make her a partner in the lucrative network of Boticas and allow her to incorporate elixirs of her total invention into the offer, but that she would never reveal their secret formulas and if in seven years she did not manage to double the capital, she she would become his slave and give him the lands and possessions of his family in the middle of the Euphrates and the Tigris. Pifiar accepted and before the scribe he signed a contract and power of attorney to Modená who from that day managed the business, happening that things improved in such a way, Pifiar became fond of counting gold coins and buying pearls and precious stones from the four corners of the city. land. ![image.png](https://images.ecency.com/DQmZzXMMRxukJYLKf3CrDjK12RsfGG6agT5MyrgvooZ6uRQ/image.png) [Fuente](https://pixabay.com/es/photos/asiria-mesopotamia-babilonia-1827296/) //////////////////////////////////////////////// -O - //////////////////////////////////////////// Fractured the stele at this point we do not know the details of the most prosperous years of Pifiar and Modená, but at the base there is an unexpected and revealing end. /////////////////////////////////////////////// -OR- ///////////////////////////////////////////// Calm spring days were running, after overcoming the deadly plague that devastated all the known kingdoms, when surprisingly Pifiar and Modená received a summons to present themselves at the end of the distance in front of Pharaoh. Gathered the courtiers, sages and priest to the left and right, in the center stood erect and defiant those who looked like dervishes from the desert or distant India who, before the entire court, when Pifiar and Modená appeared, repeated the accusation known to those present: The wealthy apothecaries, greatly enriched with their elixirs, had spread the plague through their preparations and some were cured and others were not, a mystery of nature. As their strongest argument, they presented the well-known apothecary jars and challenged the owners to ingest it immediately in the presence of Pharaoh and the court. Pifiar drank and Modená insolently drank and bathed with the contents of the remaining bottles, rushing against Pharaoh, who, protected by his guards, witnessed with astonished eyes the death of both and some of the guards. Some historians believe that this was the cause of the disappearance of apothecaries in ancient times, not appearing until 1221 in Florence.

root_title: Es ist Zeit die Corona-Diktatur zu beenden: Lebe Deinen Traum und lebe Dein Leben
body:
Na gut -- stell dir eine Kreuzung vor an einer Hauptverkehrsstraße am Freitag späten Nachmittag .. eigentlich 2 Kreuzungen, eine mit und eine ohne Verkehrsampel (oder sonstige Regelung oder Überwachung)  .. und jetzt sag mir bitte, wo ist ein Übergang für eine gehbehinderte alte Frau, eine Schulklasse auf Ausflug und einen Radfahrer sicherer .. ganz zu schweigen von Kraftfahrzeugen, die kleiner sind als zB LKWs deren Fahrer unter Zeitdruck stehen etc .... 
Und jetzt lassen wir den Freitag Nachmittag und schätzen die Unfälle, Zusammenstöße, überfahrenen Zivilpersonen übers Jahr - bei der geregelten und ungeregelten Kreuzung .. 

Selbstverantwortung kann immer nur im Rahmen der zumutbaren Fähigkeiten einer Person verlangt und gewährt werden .. unterschiedliche Intelligenz, Begabung, Wissen, charakterliche Veranlagungen bis hin zur Tagesverfassung machen übergeordnete Regelungen (und die Möglichkeit der Erzwingung der Einhaltung)  notwendig -- für die betreffende Person sowie die Umwelt, die von den unzureichenden Fähigeiten einer selbstbestimmten und damit bestimmenden Person zu leiden hätte ! 

Im sehr hoch entwickelten Sumer, dessen Errungenschaften bis heute in unsere Wissenschaft und Gebräuche hineinspielen, hat man lange vor Hammurabi schon eine unterschiedliche Rechtssprechung entwickelt .. wer "höher" stand, hatte wohl mehr Rechte, aber auch mehr Verantwortung und wurde zB für das Töten eines Sklaven schwerer bestraft, als wenn ein Sklave einen anderen Sklaven getötet hat .. 

Die Fiktionen von der führerlosen seligen klassenlosen ungeregelten Gemeinschaft auf der "Selbstbestimungsbasis" sind genauso  theoretische Hirngespinste wie andere fruchtlose Experimente in der Geschichte -- begonnen bei den Mazdakisten lange vor  Alexander dem Großen in Persien und schmerzhaft zusammengebrochen in unseren Tagen mit dem Ostblock .. 

Übrigens beim Volk auch gar nicht begehrt .- das Volk WILL ja starke Führer -- sonst wären die nicht verpönt und verboten unter dem derzeitigen Regime ... und will sich um seinen eigenen Kram kümmern, um seine Liebschaften, täglichen kleinen Freuden und Leiden und ein bißchen was aufbauen und sparen können, ein wenig Sicherheit und Hoffnung für sich und die Kinder .. das wars dann schon -- um die großen Entscheidungen, um Recht oder internationale Bündnisse kümmert sich das Volk einen Schmarrn - dafür bezahlt es Steuern, um andere das machen zu lassen .. und das ist auch gut so .. wenn diese "anderen" eben die Richtigen wären .. dazu siehe oben ..

root_title: The truth about Governments and Citizens !
body:
![memorial-1621728_1280.jpg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmUbfB8TBUtgDqvZcbUfSk3ypJwhVbqRn1d28KHgcZAPYH/memorial-1621728_1280.jpg)

*It's one of the hardest topics I ever wrote about. I mean : ''The existence of governments and citizens !''*

We all know that there are many countries on the earth. And each country has its own government. But we rarely think about what's exactly the government. Usually it's a group of people who are considered as authorities. So, we consider those people as those who know what to do. We admit their power and this is the most important thing to think about. Looking at the meaning of ''authority'' on this website : [Essential Meaning of authority](https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/authority) : 

> the confident quality of someone who knows a lot about something or who is respected or obeyed by other people. 

So, everything is defined in the meaning of the word. Just like we have to respect them anyway. Maybe no matter what they do, because it's considered that they always know what to do. But in fact they are also people, just like us. 

*I always thought about how all the world functions, and I'm finally getting a better picture of it.* 

I joined many telegram chats where people actively discuss all these things to protect themselves of what's going on. Mostly to protect their rights. But without knowledge, it's really impossible to do. We used to delegate everything to others. Our personal data to administrations and organizations. The education to schools and universities. Our health to hospitals and doctors. And even after death, there are funeral homes who take care of bodies. And we can't live without those organizations because they are making our lives easier, and they are good for our comfort zones. So, most of us give births in hospitals. Send their kids to school. Work for others. And in the end we turn like in matrix where a lot of things are decided for us by others. But we have to think, why it's happening. 

In fact, we are alive human beings. And those papers that makes us who we are, aren't what defines who we really are ! Those papers are just linked to us by the system. We are the holders. And when we have any relation from the system with us, in fact that relation is with that paper, but not with the person holding it. So, we accepted to play the role of that person who represent the paper we hold. And all this coming from one root ! It's called ''Promissory note''. Check that here : [A promissory note, sometimes referred to as a note payable](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Promissory_note) : 

> is a legal instrument in which one party (the maker or issuer) promises in writing to pay a determinate sum of money to the other (the payee). 

Those promissory notes were created even before Christ. The first of them you can find in [Code of Hammurabi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Code_of_Hammurabi#Laws). Really interesting laws to read ! But the most recent ones are related somehow with the Vatican. I'm not sure about this information, but depending on what I learned, the Vatican is the main center of all those promissory notes. I also learned that when anyone is burn on earth, all the information about him/her will go there and to other a few places to let people who make the accountability know about that. But, I'm still learning about that, that's why I wrote that's hard for me ! 

We can see as well that the modern promissory notes are created in 1930 already. So, there is [Convention Providing a Uniform Law for Bills of Exchange and Promissory Notes](https://www.jus.uio.no/english/services/library/treaties/09/9-03/bills-exchange-notes.xml) and [ "Convention providing a Uniform Law for Bills of Exchange and Promissory Notes".](https://treaties.un.org/Pages/LONViewDetails.aspx?src=LON&id=551&chapter=30&clang=_en). The first retrieved in 2014 and the second in 2018. So, both are fresh, and it's strange that they retrieved them recently. Just a few years before the pandemic. The same about [Nuremberg Code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuremberg_Code) that should be active till now, but many points in it are not respected. 

It's good as well to learn about [Canon law](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canon_law) to understand a lot of things about how all the documents in the world are regulated. The interesting thing is that law is coming from church. 

> The Catholic Church has what is claimed to be the oldest continuously functioning internal legal system in Western Europe. 

And most of the constitutions are written based on [1917 Code of Canon Law](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1917_Code_of_Canon_Law). It was changed during the history, but the main laws are clear. 

We should as well look at [Human rights](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_rights). What brought after the creation of [Universal Declaration of Human Rights (UDHR)](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/udhr.pdf).  Worldwide agencies created that. And they are so clear. Especially I like what's written in the first article : 

> All human beings are born free and equal in dignity and rights.

And the fifth : 

> No one shall be subjected to torture or to cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment
or punishment.

And nothing can cancel those rights, because we were all born with those rights. 

*After all we are all living in a juridical space. And we all have the ability to defend our rights !*

#### Of course, without knowing about all the rights we have, we can't achieve what you want. That's why we have to learn about the bases of all that to implement it the right way. And if we can't do that ourselves, we should find a competent lawyer who knows all that in details !

root_title: What are the origins of Seigniorage?
body:
![image.png](https://images.ecency.com/DQmdaPTF7bRfBeAhniwmuWmH3qXme1B6zVewwqKGJwbqd1i/image.png)
To arrive at an answer to this question  must first take a step back in history.

**Do you remember when at school they talked to you about bartering?**

Well, at a certain point, however, we preferred to start using other things such as tea, shells, salt, so much that even today we talk about salary. These were all divisible and non-perishable goods, called "commodity money". Then precious metals such as **gold**, **silver** and **copper** take first place as a method of exchange. In particular **gold**, which begins to become popular at the beginning of civilization, a period that goes roughly between the fifth and fourth millennium BC. At the time we find nothing less than the visualizations of Egyptians and Sumerians.

Historians cannot explain how these civilizations, apparently born out of nowhere, manage to develop advanced technologies to extract gold and process it since it must be melted at around 1000°C. After all, only today can we have the technologies to use it in various industries, from luxury to electronics.

**So, they went through all that effort to extract it and work it just to have it as an ornament?**

If we read the Egyptian hieroglyphics and some Sumerian texts, it is said that gold was used by these "Gods", understood as gods in flesh and blood who came down from heaven, and taught to these ancient different things such as mathematics, astronomy, how to cultivate plants up to how to extract gold and it is clear that these "Gods" had a particular interest in this gold.

From that moment, gold also began to be used as the main method of exchange along with silver. Not surprisingly, even today, these two metals are considered the main precious metals for investment and reserve value.

We can find one of the first historical references on money with the **“Code of Hammurabi”**. You will probably remember from school days that we were taught to make a crucial point in history since the birth of writing. One of the first writings we have is this Code of Hammurabi, **the first legislative code in history given to the sovereign Hammurabi by an Anunnaki**. With the term Anunnaki, the Sumerians, indicated these "Gods" descended from heaven (An = Heaven, Ki = Earth  "those from heaven descended to Earth"). In these early Sumerian tablets we already find several topics. They talk about money, interest, payments and all these things that these "Gods" of the sky have taught us because before, these civilizations, did not know these subjects. But this is not an article dedicated to **paleoastronautics**, so I don't want to dwell on this topic.

![image.png](https://images.ecency.com/DQmStxq6srPYVKYWnr5cWh9TYSA41AxCmtNr1R1s9vkf83U/image.png)

Image source: https://www.history.com/topics/ancient-history/hammurabi

Returning to our dear and beloved gold, we began to divide it into equal parts through the coins which, as you will remember, **minted by the sovereign who stamped his face on it** and, in exchange for this coin print, he took a small part of gold. He basically gave you a coin with face value 1 but there wasn't actually 1g of gold because he was taking, for example, 0.1g of gold so this difference between face and actual value was like a mint fee to have the coin minted, a commission that was taken by the lord (**seigneur**), the lord's premium and...taaacc, here is where the term "**Seigniorage**" comes from. It is none other than the profit of whoever issues the currency!

Returning the example to our days, the **issuer of currency for the eurozone is the ECB**, the European Central Bank, while **for the United States we can talk about the FED**. So, both the ECB and the Fed, whenever they print money, a percentage will actually be kept by them as a "commission" on the printing.

![image.png](https://images.ecency.com/DQmVWw4tPMmJZUXp7tvonCZ6hvUdWEyAexk3ZjRiHxhzWGC/image.png)

Image source: https://marketbusinessnews.com/financial-glossary/what-is-seigniorage-definition-and-meaning/

ECB and FED, central banks, so public one would say, which should serve the interests of citizens, right? Maybe we will have the opportunity to do some research and deepen this issue in a future article.

When in doubt I think it is a good idea to continue to deepen the **crypto world**, the **decentralization** that is highlighting the cryptocurrency sector fascinates me more and more, the idea of ​​deflationary coins and being the true owner of the coin has a certain effect.

If you are new to the crypto world I would recommend this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=V-ZCAQLH2Hk

**I am sure that in the near future we could connect the central bank speech to the crypto world!**

author: kryptonita
root_title: Museo de Pérgamo
body:
Hola a todos aquí de nuevo con vos activa para seguir publicandoles sobre el país de Alemania y toda su belleza qué tiene a sus alrededores y en esta oportunidad les mostrare otro lugar más emblemático que tiene este país para mostrarnos. En esta ocasión te compartiré el museo de pérgamo, este lugar forma parte del complejo conocido como isla de los museos,que agrupa varios de los edificios más representativos de la ciudad de Berlín. La originalidad de este museo, Se inauguro en el año 1930, el lugar tiene su propio concepto,el edificio no fue construido para alvergar obras de arte sino que primero se trajieron la obra de arte y después al alrededor del mismo se construyó el edificio, de esta forma, las propias maravillas, la mayor parte de ella arquitectónicas, constituyen las paredes y las columnas de este museo. Las zonas más destacada de este museo son dedicadas el islam, Roma, Grecia y el periodo helenístico (incluyendo la ciudad de pérgamo, la misma es del nombre del museo y sobre todo también de la Mesopotamia y el próximo Oriente. Incluye tres museos en uno, la colección de antigüedades clásicas, el museo del antiguo Oriente próximo y el museo de arte islámico. la principales atracciones de la colección de antigüedades clásicas son altar de Zeus de la ciudad de pérgamo, la puerta de mercado romano de Mileto, la fachada de mushatta y estatuas helenísticas como el famoso espinario. por su parte el museo del antiguo Oriente tiene como centro la puerta de istar de Babilonia, la via prosecional, un modelo de la torre de Babel y una copia del código de Hammurabi, cabeza de carga en su 14 Sara se detienen hallazgos de excavaciones realizadas por arqueólogos alemanes de actualmente se encuentra Irak, Siria y Turquía. Museo del arte islámico de pérgamo está localizado en la ala del sur. Entre sus atracciones figura el salón de alepo y muros decorados con cerámica como nicho de oraciones konya (Turquía).
![image.png](https://images.hive.blog/DQmS4RnXzucFNGafAJnxXEfYcL2kfjzTEe92UeDeYzGv8sK/image.png)

author: arbitration
root_title: Jordan Peterson, the voice of outrage.
body:
![image.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/arbitration/23tknM58sPVTkE1Z7oXfCiNTZu4rPAnUHA1H6rjq184s9ok6VLTe4gh5QxaREaLoeB7x4.png)


https://www.rt.com/news/540038-jordan-peterson-vaccine-mandates

**RT reports: Jordan Peterson hammers ‘totalitarian’ Covid rules — RT World News**

I’m a big fan of Jordan Peterson so I’m glad to see he is recovered from his severe health problems and appears in top old form. He says he got the C-19 vaccination, *“But here’s the deal, guys, I got the vaccination so now you guys leave me the fuck alone! Did they leave me alone? No. I still have to get tested whenever I leave the country and masked in interior spaces. The restrictions when I come back to Canada are even stricter. So what did I get the vaccination for if you aren’t going to leave me alone? Stupid me! That’s how I feel about it.”*

There are cynical comments from people who refuse the jab and could have told Jordan that getting jabbed would not result in freedom. I don’t think that attitude is helpful.

In effect Jordan Peterson has put himself in the role of Everyman. Most people here in Canada are getting the jabs, 80% if our Health Authority dictators can be believed (another serious issue of course). So Jordan Peterson has been in the majority and his reasons for taking the jabs are those of the majority, that is, the desire to get back freedom and normality, to be left alone. 

Thus Peterson has the right to speak for Canada’s majority and voice the outrage which is inevitable because we were all promised in one way or another that “consenting” to the jabs would give us our freedom back. But the government does not change its approach to us after we “consent”. We are all still subject to the identical restrictions. The social contract has been broken.

The social contract? This phrase is a description of the natural and inevitable relationship between any government – democratic, autocratic, it doesn’t matter – and the subjects of that government. Here’s the deal, as Jordan puts it so plainly and honestly: we obey government rules and in return government rewards us for our obedience by giving us the right to pursue a normal life so we can work, live, produce, care for each other without being harassed. We obedient citizens don’t get harassed, only disobedient criminals get harassed. That’s the deal. It’s a two way street. We obey and in return the government gives us what is implicitly promised. That is what written law means – from Hammurabi to Magna Carta to the constitution and Charter and Criminal Code of today – it’s a contract between ruler and subject with obligations and rewards for both parties. As long as both parties adhere to the contractual obligations.

So what happens when one or the other party breaks a contract? The contract is null and void. It sounds apocalyptic and exaggerated but in essence this is the state of reality. Our government is taking our obedience and giving us nothing in return. The government is cheating us and expecting us all to lie down and take it. Obeying the rules gets us nothing but more of the same repression, harassment and instability. We Canadians are a mild folk. Too mild, that’s plain to see. But under the appearance of normality there is the cold hard reality that the law, which is the ground state of our society, has been violated by the government and the government’s actions and continued threats tell us by actions rather than words that the government has contempt for the law, for our constitution and our rights.

If anybody, government people or anybody, thinks the stability and civil peace of any society can be taken for granted they are greatly mistaken. That stability depends on laws being respected. It can dissolve in matter of days when society has become a house of cards because the law has not been upheld.

The Australian government is debating, right now, imposing lockdown, house arrest, for the 3 million Australians they say are unvaccinated. The scenes of the solid crowd of protesters in the street, wall to wall with not a cop in sight, against the Vaccination Mandate seen in Melbourne just days ago would indicate that the “unvaccinated” in Australia are a lot more than 3 million. But Australia has been the proving ground for the harshest Covid lockdowns and repression in the world. Canada is obviously next in line for anything the Australian government does. Would imposing prison on the unvaccinated mean that Australians, or Canadians, who have been jabbed will get normality back? When already Booster shots are looming on the horizon? You’d have to be pretty dumb to believe that.

Since our government is so contemptuous of the law as they have been, we have no way to believe that our ‘authorities’  will not take more liberties to themselves and remove more liberties from us whether we are nice and obedient or not. This is becoming an increasingly strange country to this born and bred Canadian. 

What sort of a country is it when our law abiding citizens are so meek and silent that Jordan Peterson is “controversial” and “offensive” for talking like a good old fashioned hockey fan and saying in plain and common language what every Canadian who obeyed our government’s mandates has the perfect right to say. You promised and you broke your promise. You treated me like a fool and a punk. Fuck you. The deal is OFF!

Because here’s the deal: there is either law respected by both the citizens and the lawmakers or there is not. If there is no law there is nothing but force. Maybe the government thinks it has all the force on its side, as the arrogant actions of the government seem to demonstrate. The government of Australia has thrown law aside and now is depending on force alone. Is that what we can expect from our government? Why not? It’s already happening. In hockey parlance they have taken the gloves off. Are we going to keep our gloves on while they beat us down with no payback? That’s just not a natural human response. The law had better be re-established, starting with the government cancelling “emergency” tyranny and returning to honouring our laws. That had better happen right soon.

root_title: [Eng+Spa] Quarantine: Day 605 + Cuarentena: Día 605
body:
Brief description of the daily life in the personal quarantine.
Breve descripción de la cotidianidad en la cuarentena personal.
![](https://www.tegustaviajar.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Museo-del-Louvre.jpg) Museo del Louvre [Image's Source - Fuente de la Imagen](https://www.tegustaviajar.com/europa/francia/paris/museo-del-louvre/) --- ![Source - https://pro-chislo.ru/605](https://pro-chislo.ru/data/moduleImages/Numbers/605/2ef44f0a982daba1bb3560762463c749.png)
A new Monday, day 605 since the declaration of quarantine in Venezuela due to the Covid19 pandemic, second week of easing, declared as a measure to reactivate trade and the economy taking advantage of the Christmas boom ... I would like ordinary people not to forget security measures, as we remain in quarantine and if the rules are relaxed we may face a dramatic increase in the number of cases by the end of the month.

In the ephemeris I see that on a day like today, in 1793, the headquarters of the Royal Academy of Painting and Sculpture of France when it was converted into a public museum, the first public and open access art gallery in the world, I speak of the Museum of the Louvre . Looking at the year, you can already have an idea that this was one of the decisions that the revolutionary government made, since this country was in the midst of the French Revolution, which ordered the transfer of the private collections of the ruling classes to a public place. So that they could be enjoyed by all citizens, this public place was chosen and, unlike other museums and art exhibition sites of the time, it did not require letters of presentation, or to announce a visit or to belong to a privileged social class to enter. It was an attempt after the massification of citizens' access to Fine Arts and High Culture.

Since its foundation, the museum has gone through different situations, pro two world wars, an open military occupation, as well as several modifications. Some of the modifications that I mention can be considered necessary updates, such as the electrical system or the latest technology surveillance and alarm system, but there is one modification that certainly in 1980 sparked an intense debate. When you look at the photo in this post, you will see a structure in front of the museum that is very obvious that it does not belong to the architecture of the 18th century ... Yes, I mean the Crystal Pyramid, which is something that it deserves in itself. Even a separate post, in short, which is something very striking and certainly one notices it, if by chance you visited the site before its construction, you may be surprised to see it in person afterwards and find that translucent pyramid in front. ..

Well, my choice of the ephemeris to central today's blog is largely because this is the most visited museum in the world and has more than 380,000 pieces of art, of which 35,000 are generally kept on display, among which are they find some as famous as da Vinci's Mona Lisa, the only stone example of the Code of Hammurabi, or sculptures such as the Victory of Samothrace and the Venus de Milo. Anyway, if you do visit it, I would recommend doing it in several trips, because I have serious doubts that you can visit the rooms in a single walk :) By the way, with this quarantine and the pandemic, I think virtual reality visits They have managed to overcome visits in person to the museum, that is a good option to visit it and enjoy its exhibitions.

After such a description of such a glorious place, because the report of my personal daily life is quite simple, it is a calm day and I am quite well, that is something good and I am glad, I want to continue like this for as long as I can, take good care of yourself , I wish you are well and we can read another time.
Un nuevo Lunes, día 605 desde la declaración de cuarentena en Venezuela por la pandemia de Covid19, segunda semana de flexibilización, declarada como una medida para reactivar el comercio y la economía aprovechando el auge navideño... me gustaría que las personas comunes no olvidaran las medidas de seguridad, pues seguimos en cuarentena y si se relajan las normas puede que nos enfrentemos a un incremento dramático del número de casos para fin de mes.

En las efemérides veo que un día como hoy, en 1793, sede de la Real Academia De Pintura y Escultura de Francia cuando fue convertida en un museo público, la primera pinacoteca pública y de acceso abierto del mundo, Hablo de el Museo del Louvre. Viendo el año, se puede ya tener una idea de que esto fue una de las decisiones que tomó el gobierno revolucionario, pues se encontraba este país en plena Revolución Francesa, que ordenó el traspaso de las colecciones privadas de las clases dirigentes a un lugar público para que pudiesen ser disfrutados por todos los ciudadanos, este lugar público fue elegido y, a diferencia de otros museos y sitios de exposición de arte de la época, no se requería ni de cartas de presentación, ni de anunciación de visita ni pertenecer a una clase social privilegiada para poder ingresar. Era un intento pos la masificación del acceso de los ciudadanos a las Bellas Artes y a la Alta Cultura.

Desde su fundación el museo ha pasado por distintas situaciones, pro dos guerras mundiales, por una ocupación militar abierta, así como varias modificaciones. Algunas de las modificaciones que menciono se pueden considerar actualizaciones necesarias, tales como el sistema eléctrico o el sistema de vigilancia y alarma de mas reciente tecnología, pero hay una modificación que ciertamente en 1980 desató un debate intenso. Al mirar la foto de este post vas a ver una estructura al frente del museo que es muy obvio que no pertenece a la arquitectura del Siglo XVIII... Si, me refiero a la Pirámide de Cristal, que es una cosa que merece por si mismo un post separado, en fin, que es algo muy llamativo y ciertamente que uno lo nota, si de casualidad visitaste el sitio antes de su construcción, puede que te lleves una sorpresa al verlo en persona después y encontrar esa pirámide traslúcida al frente...

bien, mi elección de la efemérides para central la bitácora de hoy es en buena medida porque este es el museo mas visitado del mundo y tiene mas de 380.000 piezas de arte, de las que se mantienen generalmente en exposición unas 35.000, entre las que se encuentran algunas tan famosas como la Gioconda de da Vinci, el único ejemplar en piedra del Código de Hammurabi o esculturas como la Victoria de Samotracia y la Venus de Milo. En fin, que si llegas a visitarlo, recomendaría hacerlo en varios viajes, pues tengo serias dudas de que puedas recorrer las salas en un solo paseo :) Por cierto, con esto de la cuarentena y la pandemia, creo que las visitas de realidad virtual al museo han logrado superar las visitas en persona, eso es una buena opción para visitarlo y disfrutar de sus exposiciones.

Luego de semejante descripción de un sitio tan glorioso, pues el reporte de mi cotidianidad personal es bastante simple, es un día calmado y estoy bastante bien, eso es algo bueno y me alegro, deseo seguir así durante todo el tiempo que pueda, cuídate mucho, te deseo que estés bien y nos podamos leer en otra oportunidad.

root_title: I haven't shot anyone this month. Where's my reward?
body:
As it happens with many of the news coming from the most progressive country in the world, I was shocked by the notion that [criminals in San Francisco are paid not to shoot anyone](https://www.foxnews.com/us/san-francisco-pay-people-not-shoot-gun-crimes). If you behave yourself and manage not to blow somebody's brains for a whole month you get 300 bucks! The article I read doesn't say if, for instance, you're still allowed to beat them within an inch of death. Or if you can still slit their throat. It's only about shooting or not shooting people!
This program is funded by an organization with a fancy name, the Dream Keeper Fellowship, and is targeting, what else, the black community in San Francisco. If you're white, you don't qualify. Black people, however, get paid to obey the laws (as is their duty).
I really don't see how this will help tackle the problems they have there. For the first half of this year, the number of shooting is twice as high as compared to last year. 

![image.png](https://images.hive.blog/DQmYki5z9hKfPDHStcVKsGARQazDEFCBommVxUcQgoQzEeD/image.png)

What kind of message does such a program send? What happens when the program stops. Do those concerned polish their guns and go on a rampage since there's no more money coming? Not that the money makes a difference. Seriously, those included in this program are considered to be at risk of shooting someone or being shot at. That's criminal gangs we're talking here and I don't think such fellows are interested in 300 lousy dollars. My guess is they are involved in more lucrative business.

The simple idea of rewarding people for respecting a fundamental law that governs all the nations in this world is pure lunacy. Since the first civilized societies were created people have made it a rule not to kill each other. Those who did were punished in kind.
The Code of Hammurabi is based on the 'eye for an eye' principle. Well, except when you killed a slave, that was a lesser crime punishable by fine.
'Thou shalt not kill', says the Bible.
No code of law ever mentioned the the idea of rewarding people for civilized behavior.
When you come up with such a notion you're basically reverting to barbarian times when the guy wielding the bigger stick got to live in the bigger cave. 

![image.png](https://images.hive.blog/DQmc53yk9teaecgmekwjrFbnb2JdKGwbXuue2CrdCrgxUfu/image.png)

This story goes well with another one, a few months back, when some of progressive lunatics argued for the right of the poor to steal whatever they need from the store. 
Add to that the Defund the Police movement and you have a society where the rule of law has been abolished. Or maybe it still applies to the privileged that work their asses off to buy stuff from the same store.
As it happens, I have a sister living in California and she's not doing so good after 30 years of hard work, health-wise and money-wise. Problem is she doesn't own a gun so she doesn't qualify for the $300 for not shooting anyone! (She's not black either) Maybe steal some groceries, then? At her age, I doubt it she could manage to run with a big-screen TV on her back, but I'm sure she could manage a loaf of bread and some cheese! 
As for me, I don't have a gun either, and that's a good thing with my temper!

Hola, buenas tardes, amigos de esta hermosa colmena, espero estén bien hoy compartiré un tema bien interesante sobre el Código de Hammurabi. Esta historia la encontré por internet buscando el origen de las leyes, esta es mi interpretación de lo que leí: Para la época 1700 antes de Cristo existía un Rey llamado Hammurabi, su reino era Babilonia, un hombre muy inteligente, tuvo la habilidad de manipular a todo su reino, haciéndole creer que tenía contacto con la divinidad (Dioses), creo una fórmula para que todo el poder residiera en sus manos y se encargó de que todo su reino estuviera bien informado. El Rey Hammurabi logro recopilar todas las leyes existentes en un una sola, llamada por supuesto como el Código de Hammurabi, para darle credibilidad y aceptación a este código, creo la fantasía en su pueblo, que ese Código le fue dado por los Dioses y que él era el elegido para aplicarlo. Para ese entonces los sacerdotes de la Iglesia eran los jueces, con el nuevo Código esta facultad paso al Rey y sus funcionarios, los cuales ahora eran los encargados de impartir la justicia, muy inteligente verdad?. Para el Rey era importante que el Código llegara a todos los rincones de su reino, por lo cual lo mando a cincelar en una estela de Basalto de más de dos metros y lo mando a colocar en las ciudades más importantes de su reino, aunque la mayoría de sus súbditos no sabían leer, pero él cumplía con la publicación, que tenía un efecto psicológico, para que todos se sometieran a su administración de justicia.
 El Rey Hammurabi logro muchas cosas con el Código: 
**Quedar en la historia 
**Arrebatar el carácter de jueces a los sacerdotes
**Recopilo todas las leyes existentes, penales, civiles.
**Le dio un carácter público, porque fue publicado en las ciudades más importantes de su reino, pero la mayoría de las personas para la época no sabían leer.
**Evito que la justicia se tomara por propia mano, aunque ese Código era bastante cruel.
**Se codifica todo lo referente a lo social y económico.
**Penalmente eran implacable, pues estableció “Ley del Talión”, o lo que es lo mismo “ojo por ojo, diente por diente”.(ahora si sabemos su origen)
 En aquellos tiempos era bastante corriente la pena de muerte, aunque ahora nos parezca algo grotesco, va contra los derechos humanos, fue la única manera que tenían para frenar un poco los delitos. Debo disculparme, tiendo a salirme un poco del tema que era el Código, pero cada vez que leía, solo podía pensar lo ingenioso que era el Rey, no siendo el primero en escribir ordenamientos jurídicos de aquella época, fue el que logro mejores resultados, eso dice mucho de él. 
Debo confesar el tema era el Código , pero me apasione por lo hábil del Rey 
Colmena esperando sus comentarios del el Rey Hammurabi o de su Código.

>Hello, good afternoon, friends of this beautiful hive, I hope you are well today I will share a very interesting topic about the Code of Hammurabi. I found this story on the internet looking for the origin of the laws, this is my interpretation of what I read: By the time 1700 BC there was a King called Hammurabi, his kingdom was Babylon, a very intelligent man, he had the ability to manipulate his entire kingdom, making him believe that he had contact with the divinity (Gods), he created a formula so that all power resided in his hands and took care that his entire kingdom was well informed. King Hammurabi managed to compile all the existing laws in a single one, called of course as the Code of Hammurabi, to give credibility and acceptance to this code, he created the fantasy in his people, that this Code was given to him by the Gods and that he was the chosen one to apply it. At that time the priests of the Church were the judges, with the new Code this power passed to the King and his officials, who were now the ones in charge of imparting justice, very clever, right? For the King it was important that the Code reached every corner of his kingdom, so he had it chiseled in a Basalt stele of more than two meters and placed in the most important cities of his kingdom, although most of his subjects could not read, but he complied with the publication, which had a psychological effect, so that everyone would submit to his administration of justice.
 King Hammurabi achieved many things with the Code: 
**To go down in history 
**To take away the character of judges from the priests.
**To compile all the existing laws, penal, civil.
**It gave it a public character, because it was published in the most important cities of his kingdom, but most of the people at that time did not know how to read.
**He avoided that the justice was taken by own hand, although that Code was quite cruel.
**Everything related to social and economic matters was codified.
**Penalty was implacable, because it established the "Law of Talion", or what is the same "an eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth" (now we know its origin).
 In those times the death penalty was quite common, although it seems grotesque to us now, it goes against human rights, it was the only way they had to curb crime a little. I must apologize, I tend to get a little off the subject which was the Code, but every time I read, I could only think how ingenious the King was, not being the first to write legal ordinances of that time, he was the one who achieved the best results, that says a lot about him. 
I must confess that the subject was the Code, but I was passionate about the King's skillfulness. 
Hive waiting for his comments on King Hammurabi or his Code.
